thread.title: Local sports briefs for Sept. 30: Sporting KC wins U.S. Open Cup
thread.title_full: Local sports briefs for Sept. 30: Sporting KC wins U.S. Open Cup

author: The Capital-Journal
title: Local sports briefs for Sept. 30: Sporting KC wins U.S. Open Cup
text:
Local sports briefs for Sept. 30: Sporting KC wins U.S. Open Cup Posted: September 30, 2015 - 10:55pm 
Jordi Quintilla scored the winner in the eighth round of penalty kicks, Tim Melia made two saves in the tiebreaker and Sporting Kansas City beat the Philadelphia Union on Wednesday night for their third U.S. Open Cup title. 
Sporting KC won the shootout 7-6 after the teams played to a 1-1 tie. 
John McCarthy was brought into the game in goal at the very end of extra time after leading Philadelphia to two shootout wins in the tournament, but stopped only Krisztian Nemeth as the Union lost the championship game at home for the second straight year. 
SELF ANNOUNCES KU’S COLEBY HAS ACL TEAR: Junior transfer forward Dwight Coleby will miss out on practicing during the 2015-2016 season after suffering a torn ACL in his left knee, Kansas coach Bill Self announced Wednesday in a news release. Coleby would have had to sit out the season under NCAA transfer rules. 
The release said the injury occurred Friday during a “light team workout,” and Coleby will have surgery the week of Oct. 11. 
Coleby transferred from Ole Miss, where he played in all 34 games in the 2014-15 season and averaged 5.4 points, 4.8 rebounds and 16.5 minutes.
